intro: Endlicheria juruensis, commonly known as the Juruense tree, is a species of flowering plant native to the Amazon rainforest. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its large, palmately lobed leaves and showy, five-petaled flowers that bloom in clusters. It thrives in humid, tropical climates and is often found in lowland forests. Due to its ecological importance and unique morphology, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
